intro: Antirrhinum indicum, commonly known as the Indian snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of South Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of flowers at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Antirrhinum indicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can also be found in wildflower habitats.
